hero.headline: Designing Thriving Ecosystems Across Space and Time
hero.subheading: I bring people together around shared values to create resilient, decentralized communities that transcend traditional boundaries. As an ecosystem architect, I translate vision into effective, regenerative systems.

problemStatement.title: Navigating Fragmented Digital Landscapes
problemStatement.description: In today's increasingly complex digital world, organizations struggle to build meaningful connections across fragmented spaces. Traditional organizational models are failing to adapt to decentralized environments, while the pressure to innovate often leads to extractive practices that deplete resources and human potential. As an Ecosystem Architect, I help transform these challenges into opportunities for regenerative growth.
bulletPoints: Disconnected communities lacking shared values and vision
Hierarchical structures that stifle innovation and collaboration
Digital fragmentation that isolates rather than connects
Unsustainable innovation practices that generate waste instead of value

services.title: Ecosystem Design Services
services.introduction: As an Ecosystem Architect, I help organizations and communities design thriving, interconnected systems that transcend traditional boundaries. Drawing from principles of decentralization and regenerative design, I create environments where collaboration flourishes across space and time.

items.title: Ecosystem Architecture
items.description: Design and implementation of resilient organizational ecosystems that align values, validate transformation, scale effectively, and ultimately become self-sustaining. I help you create structures that work in less mechanical, less hierarchical, and more organic ways.

items.title: Regenerative Innovation
items.description: Transform waste into opportunity through practice-based innovation approaches. I guide organizations to move beyond extraction mindsets toward regenerative systems that revitalize communities and environments.

items.title: Community Alignment
items.description: Facilitate the creation of vision types and vessels of transformation that bring stakeholders together around common values. I help you build intentional communities that transcend spatial and temporal limitations.

items.title: Decentralized Organization Design
items.description: Develop governance models and practical tools for community building across fragmented landscapes. I assist in creating minimum viable ecosystems that thrive through distributed leadership and shared ownership.

process.title: How I Work
process.introduction: As an Ecosystem Architect, I help organizations and communities design thriving systems that transcend traditional boundaries of space and time. My approach blends decentralized and regenerative design principles to create resilient, collaborative ecosystems.

steps.title: Align
steps.description: We begin by defining your ecosystem's values and vision. Through deep questioning and collaborative exploration, we create a vision type that captures your ideal future state and addresses core challenges.

steps.title: Validate
steps.description: We test your vision by creating a vessel of transformation - a tangible artifact that demonstrates commitment from key stakeholders. This validation process ensures we're building something people truly want to participate in.

steps.title: Scale
steps.description: Through iterative alignment and validation cycles, we grow your ecosystem to become self-sustaining. The goal is to develop a minimum viable ecosystem where functionality is gradually taken over by partners and stakeholders.

steps.title: Spin Out
steps.description: The final phase involves letting go and allowing the ecosystem to thrive independently. Like a farmer who plants seeds and nurtures them to harvest, we step back so the ecosystem can flourish on its own terms.

caseStudies.title: Selected Projects
caseStudies.introduction: As an Ecosystem Architect, I've helped organizations and communities design thriving, decentralized systems that transcend traditional boundaries. Here are some examples of my work creating resilient ecosystems across fragmented landscapes.

items.title: Superconnectors Network
items.challenge: Dutch startups were struggling to find the right connections to solve their critical challenges, leading to stagnation in the tech ecosystem and missed opportunities for innovation.
items.approach: Created an event format that brings startups together with the best-connected people in the Dutch tech ecosystem, enabling them to present their 'critical ask' and receive targeted support.
items.results: Established a thriving community of innovators and connectors that has accelerated growth for numerous startups, creating a self-sustaining ecosystem of collaboration that continues to evolve.

items.title: Offcourse Learning Platform
items.challenge: Traditional education systems were failing to adapt to modern learning needs, with too much focus on credentials rather than actual knowledge sharing.
items.approach: Designed and built an open source platform focused on transparent knowledge sharing, challenging preconceived notions about education through a decentralized approach.
items.results: Created an ecosystem of people and tools that prioritizes open learning over credentials and intellectual property, empowering learners to discover and develop their unique strengths.

items.title: Rizom Community Development
items.challenge: Individuals were struggling to find purpose-driven collaboration that could drive both positive societal transformation and sustainable financial success.
items.approach: Established a community framework where members are empowered to explore their passions and develop their unique strengths, fostering aligned collaboration across traditional boundaries.
items.results: Built a resilient ecosystem that transcends geographical limitations, creating a model for how distributed communities can thrive through shared values and regenerative design principles.

expertise.title: Expertise
expertise.introduction: As an Ecosystem Architect, I bring together people, values, and vision to create effective, resilient systems that transcend traditional organizational boundaries. My approach combines decentralized and regenerative design principles to foster communities that thrive across space and time.

items.title: Ecosystem Architecture
items.description: Designing intentional communities and systems that align values, validate transformation, scale effectively, and ultimately become self-sustaining. I specialize in creating environments where innovation emerges organically through collaboration.

items.title: Decentralized Organization Design
items.description: Building organizational structures that transcend traditional hierarchies and spatial limitations, enabling distributed teams to collaborate effectively across geographical and temporal boundaries.

items.title: Regenerative Innovation
items.description: Implementing practices that go beyond sustainability to actively restore and revitalize systems and communities, transforming waste into opportunity and fostering long-term resilience.

items.title: Community Building & Facilitation
items.description: Creating spaces where individuals discover their unique strengths and passions, fostering purpose-driven collaboration that drives positive societal transformation and sustainable success.

items.title: Strategic Ecosystem Development
items.description: Connecting startups and organizations with critical resources, knowledge, and networks to help them thrive in fragmented digital landscapes.

about.title: About Me
about.content:
I am an ecosystem architect, entrepreneur, thinker, and coder with a passion for bringing people together around common values to create effective ecosystems. My work focuses on designing decentralized and regenerative systems that transcend traditional organizational models.

With a PhD in Philosophy from Utrecht University, I've worked as a researcher and teacher at several institutions including Utrecht, Berlin, Amsterdam, and Minneapolis. My journey has led me from traditional academia to founding multiple innovative ventures including Rizom, Superconnectors Network, and previously Offcourse.

My approach combines philosophical depth with practical implementation, focusing on four key movements: Align, Validate, Scale, and Spin Out. I believe in creating systems that work in less mechanical, less hierarchical ways - fostering collaboration over competition.

Currently based in Taipei, Taiwan, I continue to challenge preconceived notions about education, technology, and community building. My greatest passion has always been changing the way people learn and creating ecosystems that focus on open knowledge sharing rather than credentials and intellectual property.

pricing.title: Ecosystem Architecture Services & Pricing
pricing.introduction: As an Ecosystem Architect, I offer tailored services to help organizations build resilient, decentralized systems that thrive across space and time. My pricing reflects the depth of engagement and value delivered through each package.

tiers.name: Ecosystem Assessment
tiers.description: A comprehensive analysis of your current organizational ecosystem with actionable recommendations for improvement.
features: Identification of key stakeholders and relationships
Assessment of current alignment with values

tiers.name: Transformation Design
tiers.description: A collaborative process to design your minimum viable ecosystem and create vessels of transformation to validate your approach.

tiers.name: Full Ecosystem Architecture
tiers.description: End-to-end ecosystem architecture services from initial alignment through scaling and eventual spin-out of your self-sustaining ecosystem.
features: Complete alignment and vision type development
Vessel of transformation design and implementation

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.introduction: Here are answers to some common questions about my ecosystem architecture services. If you have additional questions, please don't hesitate to reach out.

items.question: What exactly is ecosystem architecture?
items.answer: Ecosystem architecture is the practice of designing virtual spaces where people can come together around shared values. Unlike traditional organizational design, ecosystem architecture works bottom-up rather than top-down, focusing on creating environments where complex systems can emerge and thrive across space and time. I help organizations build decentralized, regenerative ecosystems that transcend traditional spatial and temporal boundaries.

items.question: How does your ecosystem architecture process work?
items.answer: My process follows four key movements: 1) Align - defining values and creating a vision type, 2) Validate - testing commitment through vessels of transformation, 3) Scale - iteratively growing toward a minimum viable ecosystem, and 4) Spin Out - letting the ecosystem thrive independently. Throughout this process, we'll work collaboratively to ensure your ecosystem reflects your unique values and goals.

items.question: How long does it typically take to develop an ecosystem?
items.answer: Ecosystem development is not a linear process with a fixed timeline. Unlike traditional projects, ecosystems emerge and evolve organically. That said, we typically see meaningful progress through the alignment and validation phases within 3-6 months. Building toward a minimum viable ecosystem often takes 1-2 years, depending on complexity and scale. I'll work with you to establish realistic milestones while maintaining the flexibility needed for organic growth.

items.question: What types of organizations benefit most from ecosystem architecture?
items.answer: Organizations that thrive with ecosystem architecture are those looking to move beyond hierarchical structures toward more organic, decentralized models. This approach is particularly valuable for innovation communities, educational initiatives, tech platforms seeking to build genuine communities, and organizations navigating fragmented digital landscapes. If you're seeking to create lasting transformation rather than just building products or services, ecosystem architecture may be right for you.

items.question: What makes your approach to ecosystem architecture unique?
items.answer: My approach draws from diverse disciplines including philosophy, coding, media theory, and regenerative design. With experience founding multiple ecosystem-based initiatives like Rizom and the Superconnectors Network, I bring both theoretical understanding and practical implementation skills. I'm particularly focused on helping organizations navigate our fragmented internet landscape while building resilient, purpose-driven communities that can transcend traditional spatial and temporal limitations.

items.question: Do you offer consulting or implementation services?
items.answer: I offer both strategic consulting and hands-on implementation support. Some clients prefer guidance as they implement ecosystem architecture principles themselves, while others want more direct involvement in building their ecosystem. We can discuss your specific needs and create a customized engagement that provides the right level of support for your organization.
